armorRunes.name: Slick
armorRunes.text: This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

armorRunes.name: Slick (Greater)
armorRunes.text: This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.The item bonus is +2.

armorRunes.name: Slick (Major)
armorRunes.text: This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.The item bonus is +3.

armorRunes.name: Shadow
armorRunes.text: Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.
armorRunes.usage: etched onto light or medium nonmetallic armor

armorRunes.name: Shadow (Greater)
armorRunes.text: Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.The item bonus is +2.
armorRunes.usage: etched onto light or medium nonmetallic armor

armorRunes.name: Shadow (Major)
armorRunes.usage: etched onto light or medium nonmetallic armor
armorRunes.text: Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.The item bonus is +3.

armorRunes.name: Glamered
armorRunes.text: This armor can be disguised with a mere thought. or a similar effect can attempt to disbelieve this illusion, with a DC of 25.
armorRunes.effect: You change the shape and appearance of this armor to appear as ordinary or fine clothes of your imagining. The armor’s statistics do not change. Only a creature that is benefiting from

armorRunes.name: Energy-Resistant
armorRunes.text: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiplerunes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, awould give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

armorRunes.name: Energy-Resistant (Greater)
armorRunes.text: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiplerunes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, awould give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.You gain resistance 10 to the specified damage type.

armorRunes.name: Invisibility
armorRunes.text: Light seems to partially penetrate this armor...
armorRunes.effect: Whispering the command word, you become invisible for 1 minute, gaining the effects of a 2nd-level

armorRunes.name: Invisibility (Greater)
armorRunes.effect: Whispering the command word, you become invisible for 1 minute, gaining the effects of a 2nd-level
armorRunes.text: Light seems to partially penetrate this armor...You can activate the armor up to three times per day.

armorRunes.name: Sinister Knight
armorRunes.text: Sinister knight armor shrouds the wearer’s identity in secrecy, allowing Crimson Reclaimers to pass among foes without being immediately unmasked. The wearer gains a +1 item bonus to checks. sinister knight , and even a creature that successfully notices the wearer with its lifesense mistakes the wearer for an undead unless it critically succeeds at its Perception check or the wearer critically fails a Deception or check. Finally, while in the disguise, the rune attempts to any effects that would reveal your alignment; on a successful counteract check, rather than negate the effect, the rune causes the effect to perceive your alignment as evil (maintaining any lawful or chaotic component of your alignment). The wearer can the disguise, and if the wearer’s armor is removed, the disguise deactivates automatically.
armorRunes.effect: armor’s disguise is active, any identifying insignia or aesthetic of the armor is replaced by generic malevolent aesthetics such as spikes or demonic faces. While in the disguise, the wearer is always considered to be taking precautions against

armorRunes.name: Fortification
armorRunes.text: Arune wards against the most deadly attacks. Each time you’re critically hit while wearing the etched armor, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This property thickens the armor, increasing its Bulk by 1 and the Strength required to reduce its penalties by 2.
armorRunes.usage: etched onto medium or heavy armor

armorRunes.name: Fortification (Greater)
armorRunes.usage: etched onto medium or heavy armor
armorRunes.text: Arune wards against the most deadly attacks. Each time you’re critically hit while wearing the etched armor, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This property thickens the armor, increasing its Bulk by 1 and the Strength required to reduce its penalties by 2.The flat check DC is 14.

armorRunes.name: Rock-Braced
armorRunes.text: Rock-braced armor makes you as hard to move as a boulder. Whenever another creature attempts to forcibly move you from your space, you gain a +4 item bonus to your Fortitude DC against the check to move you. If the creature would not normally need to attempt a check to move you, then the creature must succeed at an check against your Fortitude DC (including the +4 item bonus) or you are unmoved.
armorRunes.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 75
armorRunes.usage: etched onto medium or heavy armor

armorRunes.name: Antimagic
armorRunes.text: This intricate rune displaces spell energy, granting you a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magical effects. spell and a counteract modifier of +26. dispel magic
armorRunes.trigger: A spell targets you or includes you in its area;
armorRunes.effect: The armor attempts to counteract the triggering spell with the effect of a 7th-level

armorRunes.name: Ethereal
armorRunes.text: An ethereal rune replicates armor on the Ethereal Plane. spell. This doesn’t require concentration and lasts for 10 minutes or until you choose to return to material form as a free action. ethereal jaunt
armorRunes.effect: You gain the effects of an

armorRunes.name: Armor Potency (+1)
armorRunes.craftrequirements: You are an expert in Crafting.
armorRunes.text: Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.You can upgrade therune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.

armorRunes.name: Armor Potency (+2)
armorRunes.craftrequirements: You are a master in Crafting.
armorRunes.text: Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.You can upgrade therune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 2, and the armor can be etched with two property runes.

armorRunes.name: Armor Potency (+3)
armorRunes.text: Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.You can upgrade therune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 3, and the armor can be etched with three property runes.

armorRunes.name: Resilient
armorRunes.text: runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.You can upgrade therune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.

armorRunes.name: Resilient (Greater)
armorRunes.text: runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.You can upgrade therune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.The armor grants a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

armorRunes.name: Resilient (Major)
armorRunes.text: runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.You can upgrade therune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.The armor grants a +3 item bonus to saving throws.

weaponRunes.name: Weapon Potency (+1)
weaponRunes.craftrequirements: You are an expert in Crafting.
weaponRunes.text: Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.You can upgrade therune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.

weaponRunes.name: Weapon Potency (+2)
weaponRunes.craftrequirements: You are a master in Crafting.
weaponRunes.text: Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.You can upgrade therune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.The item bonus to attack rolls is +2, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes.

weaponRunes.name: Weapon Potency (+3)
weaponRunes.text: Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.You can upgrade therune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.The item bonus to attack rolls is +3, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes.

weaponRunes.name: Striking
weaponRunes.text: Arune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, awould deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.You can upgrade therune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.

weaponRunes.name: Striking (Greater)
weaponRunes.text: Arune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, awould deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.You can upgrade therune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.The weapon deals three weapon damage dice.

weaponRunes.name: Striking (Major)
weaponRunes.text: Arune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, awould deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.You can upgrade therune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.The weapon deals four weapon damage dice.

weaponRunes.name: Kin-Warding
weaponRunes.text: A kin-warding clan dagger can deflect attacks aimed at your allies. When you use the weapon’s trait, you can point the clan dagger at an adjacent ally instead of defending yourself, creating a shield of runes around them. The runic barrier grants your ally the weapon’s circumstance bonus to AC, but you do not gain the bonus yourself.
weaponRunes.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 75

weaponRunes.name: Returning
weaponRunes.text: When you make a thrown Strike with this weapon, it flies back to your hand after the Strike is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

weaponRunes.name: Ghost Touch
weaponRunes.text: The weapon can harm creatures without physical form. A ghost touch weapon is particularly effective against incorporeal creatures, which almost always have a specific weakness to ghost touch weapons. Incorporeal creatures can touch, hold, and wield ghost touch weapons (unlike most physical objects).

weaponRunes.name: Disrupting
weaponRunes.text: Aweapon pulses with positive energy, dealing an extra 1d6 positive damage to undead. On a critical hit, the undead is also enfeebled 1 until the end of your next turn.

weaponRunes.name: Disrupting (Greater)
weaponRunes.criticalsuccess: It’s enfeebled 1 until the end of your next turn.
weaponRunes.success: It’s enfeebled 2 until the end of your next turn.
weaponRunes.failure: It’s enfeebled 3 until the end of your next turn.
weaponRunes.text: Aweapon pulses with positive energy, dealing an extra 1d6 positive damage to undead. On a critical hit, the undead is also enfeebled 1 until the end of your next turn.Increase the extra damage to 2d6. On a critical hit, instead of being enfeebled 1, the undead creature must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save with the following effects. This is an incapacitation effect.

weaponRunes.name: Shifting
weaponRunes.text: With a moment of manipulation, you can shift this weapon into a different weapon with a similar form.
weaponRunes.effect: The weapon takes the shape of another melee weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. The weapon’s runes and any precious material it’s made of apply to the weapon’s new shape. Any property runes that can’t apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply.

weaponRunes.name: Wounding
weaponRunes.text: Weapons with wounding runes are said to thirst for blood. When you hit a creature with a wounding weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 persistent bleed damage. On a critical hit, it instead deals 1d12 persistent bleed damage.
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon

weaponRunes.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 75
weaponRunes.name: Bloodbane
weaponRunes.text: Aclan dagger is especially vicious against the ancestral enemies of the clan. When you damage an appropriate type of creature with the weapon, that creature takes 1 persistent bleed damage. The type of creature depends on the clan that made the dagger, but is typically drow, duergar, giant, or orc.In addition, whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with aweapon (whether from its innate ability or in some other way), the weapon leaves ragged wounds. The bleeding creature must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or become sickened 1. The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

weaponRunes.name: Greater Bloodbane
weaponRunes.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 75
weaponRunes.text: Aclan dagger is especially vicious against the ancestral enemies of the clan. When you damage an appropriate type of creature with the weapon, that creature takes 1 persistent bleed damage. The type of creature depends on the clan that made the dagger, but is typically drow, duergar, giant, or orc.In addition, whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with aweapon (whether from its innate ability or in some other way), the weapon leaves ragged wounds. The bleeding creature must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or become sickened 1. The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.The weapon deals 1d4 bleed damage to creatures designated as the clan’s enemy, and the DC of the Fortitude save to avoid becoming sickened is 30.

weaponRunes.name: Corrosive
weaponRunes.text: Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target’s armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.

weaponRunes.name: Corrosive (Greater)
weaponRunes.text: Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target’s armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.The acid damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s acid resistance. Increase the acid damage dealt to armor or a shield on a critical hit to 6d6.

weaponRunes.name: Flaming
weaponRunes.text: This weapon is empowered by flickering flame. The weapon deals an additional 1d6 fire damage on a successful Strike, plus 1d10 persistent fire damage on a critical hit.

weaponRunes.name: Flaming (Greater)
weaponRunes.text: This weapon is empowered by flickering flame. The weapon deals an additional 1d6 fire damage on a successful Strike, plus 1d10 persistent fire damage on a critical hit.Increase the persistent damage on a critical hit to 2d10. Fire damage dealt by this weapon (including the persistent fire damage) ignores the target’s fire resistance.

weaponRunes.name: Frost
weaponRunes.text: This weapon is empowered with freezing ice. It deals an additional 1d6 cold damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target is also slowed 1 until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a DC 24 Fortitude save.

weaponRunes.name: Frost (Greater)
weaponRunes.text: This weapon is empowered with freezing ice. It deals an additional 1d6 cold damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target is also slowed 1 until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a DC 24 Fortitude save.The save DC is 34. Cold damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s cold resistance.

weaponRunes.name: Shock
weaponRunes.text: Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.

weaponRunes.name: Shock (Greater)
weaponRunes.text: Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.Electricity damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s electricity resistance (and the other creatures’ on a critical hit).

weaponRunes.name: Thundering
weaponRunes.text: This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

weaponRunes.name: Thundering (Greater)
weaponRunes.text: This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).The save DC is 34, and the deafness is permanent. Sonic damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s sonic resistance.

weaponRunes.name: Grievous
weaponRunes.text: When your attack roll with this weapon is a critical hit and gains the critical specialization effect, you gain an additional benefit depending on the weapon group.
weaponRunes.axe: You can damage a third creature, with the same restrictions.
weaponRunes.bow: The Athletics check to pull the missile free is DC 20.
weaponRunes.brawling: The target takes a –4 circumstance penalty to its save.
weaponRunes.club: You can knock the target up to 15 feet away.
weaponRunes.dart: The base persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.
weaponRunes.flail: You move the target 5 feet. You can’t move it away from you, but you can move it in another direction of your choice.
weaponRunes.hammer: You can also knock the target 5 feet away from you.
weaponRunes.knife: The target takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speed while it has the persistent bleed damage.
weaponRunes.pick: The extra damage from the critical specialization effect increases to 4 per weapon damage die.
weaponRunes.polearm: You can move the target up to 10 feet.
weaponRunes.shield: You can knock the target up to 10 feet away.
weaponRunes.sling: The target also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round if it fails the save.
weaponRunes.spear: The clumsy condition lasts for 2 rounds.
weaponRunes.sword: The target is flat-footed until the end of your next turn.

weaponRunes.name: Serrating
weaponRunes.text: A serrating weapon’s bladed edge separates into jagged, swirling shards that spin along the blade. When dealing slashing damage, the weapon deals an additional 1d4 damage. serrating
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a slashing melee weapon
weaponRunes.effect: rune adds an additional 1d12 damage instead of the additional 1d4 damage, and then the shards return to their usual speed.

weaponRunes.name: Anarchic
weaponRunes.text: An anarchic rune is jagged and asymmetrical, channeling chaotic energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 chaotic damage against lawful targets. If you are lawful, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon. When you critically succeed at a Strike with this weapon against a lawful creature, roll 1d6. On a 1 or 2, you deal double minimum damage; on a 3 or 4, double your damage normally; on a 5 or 6, you deal double maximum damage.
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a weapon without an

weaponRunes.name: Axiomatic
weaponRunes.text: Complex and symmetrical, an axiomatic rune imbues a weapon with lawful energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 lawful damage against chaotic targets. If you are chaotic, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon. When you critically succeed at an attack roll with this weapon against a chaotic creature, instead of rolling, count each weapon damage die as average damage rounded up (3 for d4, 4 for d6, 5 for d8, 6 for d10, 7 for d12).
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a weapon without an

weaponRunes.name: Holy
weaponRunes.text: Holy weapons command powerful celestial energy. A weapon with this rune deals an extra 1d6 good damage against evil targets. If you are evil, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a weapon without an
weaponRunes.trigger: You critically succeed at an attack roll against an evil creature with the weapon;
weaponRunes.effect: You regain HP equal to double the evil creature’s level. This is a good, positive, healing effect.

weaponRunes.name: Unholy
weaponRunes.text: An unholy rune instills fiendish power into the etched weapon. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 evil damage when it hits a good target. If you are good, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a weapon without a
weaponRunes.trigger: You critically succeed at an attack roll against a good creature with the weapon;
weaponRunes.effect: The target takes persistent bleed damage equal to 1d8 per weapon damage die of the etched weapon.

weaponRunes.name: Dancing
weaponRunes.text: A dancing weapon flies autonomously and strikes your foes. dancing
weaponRunes.effect: Each round, when the weapon is finished using its actions, attempt a DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the activation ends and the weapon falls to the ground. You can’t activate the item again for 10 minutes.

weaponRunes.name: Spell-Storing
weaponRunes.text: A spell-storing rune creates a reservoir of eldritch energy within the etched weapon. A spellcaster can spend 1 minute to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower into the weapon. The spell must have a casting of 2 actions or fewer and must be able to target a creature other than the caster. The spell has no immediate effect—it is instead stored for later. When you wield a spell-storing weapon, you immediately know the name and level of the stored spell. A spell-storing weapon found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell of the GM’s choice stored in it.
weaponRunes.requirements: On your previous action this turn, you hit and damaged a creature with this weapon;
weaponRunes.effect: Harmlessly expend the stored spell. This frees the weapon to have a new spell cast into it.

weaponRunes.name: Keen
weaponRunes.text: The edges of a keen weapon are preternaturally sharp. Attacks with this weapon are a critical hit on a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This property has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon

weaponRunes.name: Ancestral Echoing
weaponRunes.text: The wisdom of this weapon’s past owners flows into your mind, amplifying your own abilities with the weapon. Your proficiency rank with this weapon is one step higher than normal, to a maximum of the highest proficiency rank you have in any weapon. For instance, if you had master proficieny with martial weapons and expert proficiency with advanced weapons, you would have master proficiency with advanced weapon that had this rune. In addition, while wielding the ancestral echoing weapon, you have expert proficiency in one skill relevant to one or more of the weapon’s previous owners. This is typically Dwarven Lore but is ultimately determined by the GM depending on the weapon’s history.
weaponRunes.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 75

weaponRunes.name: Speed
weaponRunes.text: Attacks with a speed weapon are supernaturally swift. While wielding a speed weapon, you gain the quickened condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a Strike with the etched weapon.

weaponRunes.name: Vorpal
weaponRunes.text: Originally created as a means of slaying the legendary jabberwock, vorpal weapons prove equally effective against nearly any foe with a head.
weaponRunes.usage: etched onto a slashing melee weapon
weaponRunes.frequency: You roll a natural 20 on a Strike with the weapon, critically succeed, and deal slashing damage. The target must have a head;
weaponRunes.effect: The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or be decapitated. This kills any creature except ones that don’t require a head to live. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head.
